comment: Ended up being basically a comparative religions class, which I wasn't expecting, but loved the professor! Amazing lecture skills and has a lot of passion! He could talk about grass growing and I wouldn't mind. Interesting assignments too. Definitely plan on taking him in the future! Pretty easy class too. Take him!!!

Dr. Keene is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. He is one of the best professors at KSU, if not THE best. Some say his lectures are scattered, but I disagree. Dr. Keene "connects the dots" between different subjects. This kind of holistic instruction helped me remember information and made the class even more interesting. Be respectful, work hard
One of my favorite teachers and loved what he was interesting

He's one of the best I've had so far at KSU. Gives insightful lectures and takes no sides when discussing religion; points out the good and bad of all. Wish he taught American History courses so I could take him again!

Dr. Keene is the BEST professor at KSU. He is so intelligent and a pleasure to listen to. His class is extremely interesting, and I can't count the # of times I have recited the material at dinner parties and so forth. Go to class, take notes THOROUGHLY, go to reviews, and be interactive... That's all! It's an awesome class!!!!

Prof Keene's class was a lot of fun!  I had him for World History.  Tests are essay and site visit with paper required.  Lectures are interesting, but be sure to record his lectures--he likes to jump around ALOT and get off topic sometimes.

INFATUATED with subject. Very knowledgeable of Indian history and had many one of a kind stories to tell.BUT, Tons of reading(some 8 books) during semester. Scattered lecture sometimes, while others were interesting and clear. No paper, but journal in which you write 25 entries. Outside trips(3) required to make entries in journal.

Far from the easiest professor you'll ever have.  He knows his stuff very well but lectures are not the most organized.  Make sure you attend any/all study sessions if available.  Also print the epigram list he gives you, listen to the lecture and take notes furiously when he mentions something on that list.  You'll learn a lot.

Dr. Keene was an absolute joy to have! He is so passionate about history, but also about teaching. He makes it come alive in the classroom. His tests are all essays, so be wary if that is your nemesis. But he grades very fair. Reading quizzes, 1 paper and online reading questions too. Easy as pie if you show up, take notes, and put in some effort.

Dr. Keene is awesome.  He knows alot of stuff.  Attending the study sessions before the test was really helpful.  Do attend those. He gives you opportunity for extra credit.  All of his test are essay.  Buy a few green books.  Enjoy him-He knows alot of stuff.  He is very milded mannered.  He has been at KSU for 34 years.

he is very knowledgable, but his lectures are very scattered. it is hard studying for the tests because class lectures jump from one thing to the next. nice professor, but his grading is very subjective

Dr. Keene is GREAT! You will learn ALOT in his classes and his strong passion for history shows in his daily lectures. Has an extreme level of knowledge (of anything it seems) and is an amazing inspiration to anyone pursuing history. Any student would benefit from his classes. You will not regret taking him! Hands down.

Awesome professor!! His lectures are interesting and organized. The tests were not easy, but reasonable if you have all the notes and study well. He gives three papers, readings for each class, a few quizzes, and three tests.

If you want to expand your critical thinking skills then take Dr. Keene's class, for he definitely will help you in that area.  He has a good sense of humor.  He also has a beautiful smile and pretty blue eyes.  I wish I could take more classes with him.
The definition of an intellectual. He knows everything and is a pleasure to listen to. I reccommend anyone who has any interest in history to take his class. Dr. Keene will blow your mind!
Dr. Keene is great. If you take any of his classes you won't regret it.

Great professor, very helpful and extremely knowledgable. Tests can be difficult if you do not know/do not care about learning the material, simply because of the ammount of material present in an Origins of Great Traditions course. Make no mistake though, he's one of the best history professors I've had.
hard tests.epigrams are kinda easy for essays he tells which ones may be on the exam. everything else is chronological ?s but u dont know what to study for cuz hes very random in lectures.
Test are hard to study for. Essay portion is easy. He basically tells you the answers to the epigrams. Go to class, pay attention, and study and you will do fine in his class

His tests were very hard.  I was unsure what material to study.  Tests were not supposed to be cumulative, but questions were asked on tests based on material before the last test.  I only discovered this at the end of the semester.
I really liked him because he was a good lecturer and his test questions came directly from the lecture notes.  He is very knowledgable on the subject and also a really nice person.

Dr. Keene knows a lot about the subject, but he just has some trouble teaching it.  His lectures were very scattered and the tests didn't cover the lectures.  There is a lot of reading and one big paper due at the end of the semester.
